lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/chad.Chad.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run chad.Chad.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Chad is the all-in-one chatbot that helps you manage your day-to-day task and schedule.
Adds a task with a deadline into the task list.
Adds a task with a start date and end date into the task list.
Adds a task into the task list.
Delete a task from the task list.
Find a task from the task list.
Mark a task in the task list as completed.
Mark a task in the task list as incomplete.
List every task in the task list.
### `deadline` - Creates a task with a deadline
Creates a task with a given deadline and adds it into the task list.
- DATE_TIME: The date and time the task has to be done by in format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM"
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have TOTAL_TASK tasks in the list.
Creates a task with a given start date-time and end date-time, and adds it into the task list.
- START_DATE_TIME: The start date and time the task has to be done by in format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM"
- END_DATE_TIME: The end date and time the task has to be done by in format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM"
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have TOTAL_TASK tasks in the list.
### `todo` - Creates a task to be done
Creates a task and adds it into the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have TOTAL_TASK tasks in the list.
Deletes a task from the task list.
- TASK_INDEX: Index of the task in the task list
Now you have TOTAL_TASK tasks in the list.
Finds task(s) in the task list.
- QUERY_STRING: The string to be searched
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Marks the task as completed in the task list.
- TASK_INDEX: Index of the task in the task list
Noted. I've marked this task as done:
Now you have TOTAL_TASK tasks in the list.
Marks the task as incomplete in the task list.
- TASK_INDEX: Index of the task in the task list
Noted. I've marked this task as not done yet:
Now you have TOTAL_TASK tasks in the list.
Marks the task as incomplete in the task list.
* Represents a Task Management Chat Bot.
* Returns a response based on the given input.
* @param input The given user input from the GUI.
* @return The String of the response from Chad.
* Represents an Add Command to be executed.
* @param task The given Task to be added to a TaskList.
* Executes the list of commands to add a Task from a TaskList.
* @param taskList The given TaskList with the Task to be added.
* @param ui The given Ui to show the status of the adding command.
* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Executes the list of commands associated with the Command object.
* @param taskList The given TaskList required for execution of some commands.
* @param ui The given Ui required for execution of some commands.
* @param storage The given Storage required for execution of some commands.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Returns a boolean value to indicate if Command object is an exit command.
* @return True if the Command object is an ExitCommand.
* Represents a Delete command to be executed.
* @param index The TaskList index of the Task to be deleted.

* @param ui The given Ui to show the status of the deletion command.
* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents an Exit command to be executed.

* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a Find command to be executed.
* @param queryString The given String to be searched on a TaskList.

* @param ui The given Ui to show the status of the finding of the task.
* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a Mark command to be executed.
* @param index The TaskList index of the Task to be marked.
* Executes the list of commands to mark a Task from a TaskList.
* @param taskList The given TaskList with the Task to be marked.
* @param ui The given Ui to show the status of the marking of the task.
* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param taskList The given TaskList associated with the chatbot.
* @param ui The given Ui used to print the error message.
* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param ui The given Ui to show the status of the unmarking of the task.
* @param storage The given Storage that saves the TaskList locally.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents user interface of the chatbot.
* Prints the entry message of the chatbot.
* Prints the exit message of the chatbot.
this.message = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n";
* Returns a String of the current message in the Ui object and clears the message.
* Adds all the String representation of Tasks in a given TaskList.
* Adds a message to indicate that a given task has been successfully added.
this.message += "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
* Adds a message to indicate that a given task has been successfully deleted.
* Adds a message to indicate that a given task has been successfully marked.
this.message += "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n";
* Adds a message to indicate that a given task has been successfully unmarked.
this.message += "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n";
* Adds the error message from a given Exeception.
* @param e The Exception thrown from the execution of a method.
assert e != null : "Exception cannot be null";
this.message += "Oops! we encountered an error\n" + e.getMessage() + "\n";
* Adds the error message when the parser cannot find a matching command.
this.message += "Oops! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n";
* Adds the message to indicate the find query is successful.
this.message += "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
* Adds the String representation of the given Task into the message.
* @param task The given Task to be added into the message of the UI.
assert task != null : "Task cannot be null";
* Adds the message indicating the size of the TaskList.
assert taskList != null : "TaskList cannot be null";
this.message += "Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list." + "\n";
